    The FBI headquarters building in Washington, D.C. Photo: Jack Young/Unsplash

    Docomomo US' Liz Waytkus shared some insights with the New York Times recently for a look at the growing political discord inherent in public opinion of Brutalist architecture, saying the invectives by Trump and accoltyes such as Justin Shubow are an attempt to "forge a cultural war between the people that they see as the cultural elites and others."

    (One might also read their attack from the perspective of Byung-Chul Han’s theory of 'Psychopolitics,' namely Trump’s assertion of the values of Neoclassicism as a maneuver to attack Brutalism’s perceived harshness in order to generate a positive public image for his regime.)

    The General Services Administration now has until March 21st to submit recommendations for federal public buildings that "respect regional, traditional, and classical architectural heritage" per one of the new President’s first executive orders in January.
